div.head: To the right worshipful M. WILLIAM WAADE Esquire, one of the clearks of hir Maiesties most Honorable priuie Counsell.
div.p: SIR, I cannot rest vnreadie in desire, to yeeld requitall of your aide extended towards the publication of this first part of my SPECVLVM BRITANNIAE: wherin I must, and do thankfullie acknowledge your good inclination not towards me onely, but to all such as indeuour matters tending to publike good. In lieu therfore of a farther faithful recompence, accept, I beseech you, my willing indeuor, vntil time afforde ablenes to make better repay.
